attributes.action: Give priority to local residents of wombourne on housing vacancies,
attributes.additional_details: To make sure a majority of the vacant property's are allocated to the local residents first as it should be within any county, and let the wombourne residents and their families remain in the village they grew up in.
attributes.background: The local housing association are giving empty properties to outsiders of wombourne village, before considering the local people of wombourne, it has been brought to attention that families are struggling in flats and smaller homes from overcrowding, even though they are in high priority bands

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local issues are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about issues in your area you could raise it with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
